#summary command line help for the server.

{{{
USAGE: ./server.py [flags]

flags:

./server.py:
  --[no]daemonize:  Starts the server in daemon mode.
    (default: 'false')
  --game_start_timeout:  Number of seconds to wait before aborting a game that needs more player. The countdown is reset if any players join the queue or cancel.
    (default: '20')
    (an integer)
  --[no]limit_total_connections:  Whether or not to terminate after a certain amount of clients have connected. The amount is set by the max_connections flag
    (default: 'false')
  --log_level:  <CRITICAL|ERROR|WARNING|INFO|DEBUG>: The logging level
    (default: 'WARNING')
  --max_connections:  Maximum connections to accept total. Must have limit_total_connections set to True
    (default: '1')
    (an integer)
  --port:  The port for the server to listen on.
    (default: '54353')
    (an integer)

network:
  -?,--[no]help:  show this help
  --[no]helpshort:  show usage only for this module
  --object_receive_time:  The time before we give up trying to receive a serialized network 'object' after receiving its size information.
    (default: '1.0')
    (a number)
  --[no]output_network_traffic:  Whether or not to output network 'object' traffic being sent or received by a FancySocket.
    (default: 'false')
}}}
